translated: “To a sage who lived in the wilderness,🔽who had practiced for a long time,
Because of that deed, O Leader of Men,
best of men, chief of the world,
this is the fruit of my past deeds.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a drink.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pānadhidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā pānadhidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus did the Venerable Pānadhidāyaka, the Elder, utter these verses.
The Birth Story of the Elder Pānadhidāyaka is the second.
